intro: Pentagonia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pentagonal-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
